item.title: [Summary] How Discord Stores Billions of Messages
item.description: Link: HOW DISCORD STORES BILLIONS OF MESSAGES The article discusses how Discord chose and migrated to new database in order to deal with tons of stored messages. The article was published in 2017 and provided insights about data storage. Having an idea about how Cassandra read/write data is helpful to understand the content. Cassandra uses a storage structure similar to Log-Structured Merge Tree, which is known for its high performance in writing but less efficient in reading, comparing to B-Tree.
